business.headline: Adani Group gets clean chit from Sebi: ReportHindenburg had alleged that four Adani group companies lent Rs 6.2 billion ($87.4 million) in 2020, without properly disclosing it in financial statements.
Can you own a credit card without a bank account? Find outYou don't always need a savings account to apply for a credit card; new digital options are changing the rules. Have a look.

Are Fed rate cut and tariff relief setting up a market rally?A softer stance from the US Federal Reserve and the possibility of reduced reciprocal tariffs have lifted investor mood. The big question now: are these triggers enough to set off a sustained rally in Indian markets?

Sensex, Nifty extend rally on US-India trade talk optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 318.97 points to finish at 83,012.68, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 93.35 points to settle at 25,423.60. Broader markets, however, displayed mixed momentum, with several indices ending weaker as profit-booking set in.

US may scrap 25% penal duty on India, cut reciprocal tariffs to 10–15%: CEAChief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran indicated that the US reciprocal tariff on Indian goods, currently at 25%, may be reduced to 10–15%.

Missed your ITR deadline? 3 filing options you can still useIf you missed the Income Tax Return (ITR) deadline, don't panic. Taxpayers still have ways to stay compliant and avoid penalties, with three key filing options available even after the due date.

Want to get a loan this festive season? Here's what you can doFrom new clothes and jewellery to family trips and home makeovers, festivals often come with added costs. A personal loan can help bridge the gap, here's a simple guide to getting one this festive season.

iValue Infosolutions IPO opens: Should you consider subscribing?iValue Infosolutions plans to Rs 560 crore through an offer-for-sale of 1.87 crore shares. The price band is set at Rs 284–299 per share, with a minimum investment of 50 shares.

ITR refund 2025: How long will it take to reach you?Millions of taxpayers who filed their returns by the September 16 deadline are now waiting for the next big step, i.e., getting their refunds. But how long does it actually take for the money to land in your bank account?

Why gold loans are no longer just a last resort for borrowersGold loans are shedding their emergency-only image, becoming a mainstream credit choice for urban, semi-urban, and rural India, driven by gold prices, regulation, digital access, and flexible borrowing solutions.

Should investors buy IT stocks right now? Here's what Ventura Securities saysVentura Securities warns of a shift, with US-driven risks mounting, domestic sectors like banking and NBFCs offer a safer path, leaving IT investors to weigh growth against growing uncertainty.

Sensex, Nifty rise on US Fed rate cut; Infosys, Wipro gainThe S&P BSE Sensex gained over 350 points to trade above the 83,000 mark, while the NSE Nifty50 crossed 25,400 in early trade. Broader market indices also saw gains, with volatility remaining stable.

entertainment.headline: Who is Jimmy Kimmel? TV host faces suspension after controversial remarks on Charlie KirkABC has stopped airing 'Jimmy Kimmel Live!' after the host made "offensive" remarks about the death of conservative leader Charlie Kirk. The show has been taken off-air indefinitely, ending Kimmel's long late-night run for the time being.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood review: It's Aryan's love letter to the filmy chaos, dramaRelease Date:Thu Sep 18, 2025Aryan Khan's directorial debut, 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' premiered on September 18. The show isn't about exposing Bollywood, it's about embracing its madness. With wit, cameos, and chaos, the Netflix show is messy, filmy, and oh-so-fun.

Huma Qureshi wins Face of Asia Award in Busan, dedicates it to women dreamersActor Huma Qureshi was presented the Face of Asia Award at the Busan International Film Festival (BIFF). She dedicated her win to young girls who dared to dream.

Bollywood's big deja vu: Same stories, new faces, zero shameBollywood keeps serving recycled plots driven by glamour and hype. Here's exploring why stories are missing in today's big-budget films and what audiences really want.

Ed Sheeran confirms collaboration with Karan Aujla, song to be out in OctoberBritish singer Ed Sheeran confirmed his collaboration with Punjabi singer Karan Aujla. He shared that the song, which was shot in New York, will be out in October.

Team Jeremiah vs Team Conrad: Who really won in The Summer I Turned Pretty?A deep dive into 'The Summer I Turned Pretty's ultimate love triangle. Team Jeremiah vs Team Conrad - who really won, who should have, and why fans are still fighting about it.

Amaal Mallik alleges Anu Malik betrayed his father, recalls mother being mistreatedSinger-composer Amaal Mallik shared the struggles and hardships his parents underwent on 'Bigg Boss 19'. He blamed his uncle Anu Malik for betraying his father and also recalled how his mother was taunted by Daboo Malik's family.

Prakash Raj, Arjun Das's first posters raise hype for Pawan Kalyan's OGAhead of the much-anticipated gangster action drama 'OG', the makers released the first posters of Arjun Das and Prakash Raj. Starring Pawan Kalyan and Priyanka Arul Mohan, the trailer launch is set for September 21.

Actor Priyanka Mohan calls OG a blessing, praises Pawan Kalyan as true leaderActor Priyanka Mohan opened up about her experience working with Pawan Kalyan in 'They Call Him OG', calling him a true leader both on and off the screen. She described the project as a blessing.

First Spirit then Kalki 2: Deepika Padukone's abrupt exit and the controversiesOn September 18, the makers of 'Kalki 2898 AD' announced that Deepika Padukone will not be part of the sequel. Earlier this year, she made headlines for abruptly exiting Sandeep Reddy Vanga-Prabhas's 'Spirit'.

Marco producers register Lord Marco, Unni Mukundan's name missing from sequelThe makers of the Malayalam film 'Marco' have registered the title 'Lord Marco' for the sequel. With Unni Mukundan reportedly not returning, fans are buzzing with speculation about which superstar will lead the film.

KJo to launch Kajol's daughter Nysa? Actor says have received a couple of callsActor Kajol recently spoke about the future of her children and whether she feels pressured about it. She even spoke about getting a few calls from people to launch her daughter, Nysa Devgan.

Perfect: Janhvi and Varun turn street-style cool in new Sunny Sanskari songJanhvi Kapoor and Varun Dhawan set the dance floor ablaze with their latest track 'Perfect' from 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari'. The energetic number, also featuring Guru Randhawa, is poised to heighten excitement for the film ahead of its Dussehra release on October 2.

Akshay Kumar, Sujoy Ghosh shower praise on Aryan Khan's The B***ds of BollywoodActor Akshay Kumar, producer Guneet Monga and other celebrities congratulated Aryan Khan on his "incredible" debut with 'The B***ds of Bollywood'. Director Sujoy Ghosh also praised Aryan's directorial series for its humour'.

KBC 17: Visually-impaired IAS officer fails to answer Rs 50 lakh question. Can you?Visually-impaired IAS officer Ayushi participates in 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'. She decides to quit at the Rs 50 lakh question, securing Rs 25 lakh . The question involved a rock band honouring Columbia astronauts.

Why Anurag Kashyap chose Aaishvary Thackeray for Nishaanchi: Hunger over surnameFilmmaker Anurag Kashyap opens up on why debutant Aaishvary Thackeray was the perfect choice for 'Nishaanchi', praising his hunger, risk-taking, and debut in a challenging double role.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 25: Mass nominations after rule break shake up the houseIn 'Bigg Boss 19' episode 25, housemates were punished with mass nominations after breaking the rules, leading to heated confrontations, emotional breakdowns, and shifting alliances. The captaincy task further fuelled chaos with physical tussles, insults, and high drama inside the house.

The Summer I Turned Pretty finale had the most Bollywood, desi ending ever'The Summer I Turned Pretty' finale gave fans the ultimate Bollywood-style ending. From Belly and Conrad's dreamy Paris train reunion to echoes of 'DDLJ' and Yash Raj romances, here's why the show's last episode felt like pure desi cinema magic.

Actor Raghava Lawrence opens meal center, calls it a venture close to his heartTamil actor-director Raghava Lawrence named the meal center after his mother, and shared that the initiative aims to make food varieties that are usually consumed by the wealthy accessible to people with lower economic backgrounds.

general news.headline: US may scrap 25% penal duty on India, cut reciprocal tariffs to 10–15%: CEAChief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran indicated that the US reciprocal tariff on Indian goods, currently at 25%, may be reduced to 10–15%.

Live: Priyanka Gandhi joins brother Rahul in attack on BJP, poll body over 'vote chori'Rahul Gandhi vote chori press meeting Live: Congress MP and Lok Sabha LoP Rahul Gandhi steps up attack on the Election Commission, alleging large-scale voter deletions through software-driven fraud; presents 'evidence' from Karnataka to back claims. Rahul Gandhi said he would soon come out with a "hydrogen bomb" of revelations about "vote chori".

Adani Group gets clean chit from Sebi over Hindenburg claimsHindenburg, in January 2021, had alleged that Adicorp Enterprises, Milestone Tradelinks, and Rehvar Infrastructure were used as channels to route money between Adani group firms.

Neeraj Chopra fails to win medal after 7 years, young Sachin announces arrivalWorld Athletics Championships 2025: Neeraj Chopra's winning streak that lasted 7 years came to an end as his title defence in Tokyo ended in disappointment. However, 25-year-old Sachin Yadav announced his arrival on the big stage with a fourth-place finish on Thursday, September 18.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood review: It's Aryan's love letter to the filmy chaos, dramaRelease Date:Thu Sep 18, 2025Aryan Khan's directorial debut, 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' premiered on September 18. The show isn't about exposing Bollywood, it's about embracing its madness. With wit, cameos, and chaos, the Netflix show is messy, filmy, and oh-so-fun.

Baloch commander behind Jaffer Express hijacking killed in Afghanistan?Rahman Gul Baloch, the masked Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) commander believed to have masterminded the Jaffer Express hijacking, was reportedly killed in Afghanistan. There's no official confirmation yet. It was Rahman Gul Baloch, alias Ustad Mureed, a former Pakistan Army officer, who transformed the BLA's Majeed Brigade from a rudimentary force into a sophisticated one.

Will Saudi involve itself if India, Pak go to war again? What the deal meansSaudi Arabia has signed a defence pact with nuclear-armed Pakistan, vowing that any attack on either nation will be considered an attack on both. Analysts have called the pact nothing but posturing. What does it mean for India?

Visas of Indian executives, kin revoked over fentanyl trafficking link: US embassyThe US has revoked and subsequently denied visas to certain business executives and corporate leadership and their families over their alleged involvement in trafficking fentanyl precursors, the American embassy in New Delhi said on Thursday. It didn't list any names of Indians involved. The Trump administration is waging a big war against fentanyl, a synthetic drug, linked to thousands of deaths in the US every year.

Needed: A Smiling Buddha for Rahul Gandhi's Hydrogen BombRahul Gandhi, the Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha, has alleged manipulation of the election process with a second media meet in less than two months. Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar earlier aggressively countered Rahul, seeking an affidavit. The EC needs to probe and assure people that polls in India are free and fair. And this, CEC Kumar must do calmly.
The 80% gap: Why most Indians are underinsured and why it's time to actThe solution lies in choosing a comprehensive life cover that reflects modern realities.

University of Bath School of Management: Where Careers Begin With ConfidenceWith students from over 160 countries and a strong alumni network spanning 130 nations, the School creates a community that feels global in reach yet personal in experience.

Attempts to delete 6,000 voter names in Karnataka: Rahul Gandhi presents 'proof'Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday sharpened his 'vote chori' attack on the BJP and the Election Commission as he came armed with proof of systemic voter fraud, with Karnataka's Aland constituency as the prime example.

Iron Beam: Israel unveils Star Wars-style laser defence systemRafael Advanced Defence Systems officially released the Iron Beam laser system this week that could change modern military warfare forever.

Body burnt, stuffed in sacks: US woman travels to Punjab to marry NRI, killedThe incident dates back to July when Rupinder Kaur Pandher, an American citizen based in Seattle, arrived in Ludhiana at the invitation of Charanjit Singh Grewal, the 75-year-old would-be groom.

I respect all religions: Chief Justice Gavai on row over 'Go ask deity' remarkThe Chief Justice made the remarks on Tuesday while hearing a petition to restore a damaged Vishnu idol in Madhya Pradesh. While dismissing the plea, the court asked the petition to "go and ask the deity itself to do something".

Do some dadagiri at home, shop freely: Amit Shah's GST 2.0 pitch to womenShah urged women to shop freely from Sept 22, when sweeping tax rate cuts for a wide range of common-use items take effect. The appeal came with a caveat: to only buy products made in India.

Bollywood's big deja vu: Same stories, new faces, zero shameBollywood keeps serving recycled plots driven by glamour and hype. Here's exploring why stories are missing in today's big-budget films and what audiences really want.

Is cheating no longer the ultimate dealbreaker in relationships?The way couples approach relationships is evolving. Cheating, once thought to always end a partnership, is now often seen as an issue that can be worked through with honesty, effort, and forgiveness.

Deepika Padukone dropped from Kalki 2, producers say sequel deserves commitmentDeepika Paudkone will not be a part of the sequel to director Nag Ashwin's 'Kalki 2898 AD', production house Vyjayanthi Movies announced. A film like 'Kalki' deserves commitment and much more, the official statement read.

UP man's number shown at Rahul Gandhi press meet. He gets bombarded with callsAnjani Mishra, who lives in Prayagraj, said he was surprised to see his number mentioned by Rahul Gandhi at the September 18 press briefing. He complained that he was getting a barrage of calls after his number was shown.

Mark Zuckerberg's Meta AI demo goes viral after wristband glitchMark Zuckerberg's Meta Connect 2025 demo faced a major glitch when his neural wristband failed to start a video call. The incident sparked social media buzz and raised questions about the new tech's reliability.

Attendees wear Modi masks as UK MP celebrates PM's birthday in ParliamentIn a post on X, UK MP Bob Blackman shared pictures of the event, saying: "Yesterday, I was pleased to host the celebration of PM @narendramodi on his 75th Birthday in the Houses of Parliament."

Highlights: Neeraj Chopra's title defence ends, young Sachin finishes credible 4thWorld Athletics Championships Day 6 Live: Defending champion Neeraj Chopra failed to defend his title in the men's javelin final after failing to go past the 85m mark in his first five attempts. He was eighth after the fourth throw and fouled the fifth one to exit the competition. India's Sachin Yadav, meanwhile, produced a personal best of 86.27m but narrowly missed out on a medal, finishing fourth. Trinidad and Tobago's Keshorn Walcott clinched gold, Grenada's Anderson Peters secured silver, and USA's Curtis Thompson took home the bronze.

The smart guide to choosing the right protein supplement for your dietProtein plays a crucial role in your fitness and wellness, but choosing the right supplement can be confusing. This simple guide breaks it down for you.

sports.headline: IND A vs AUS A: Iyer fails, Jurel, Padikkal lead India's fightback on Day 3Shreyas Iyer continued his poor form in first class cricket with a low score against Australia A. Meanwhile, Dhruv Jurel's unbeaten century and Padikkal's strong partnership helped India A recover well.

Neeraj Chopra falters at World Athletics javelin final, fans back him to bounce backNeeraj Chopra's remarkable 26-event streak in the top two came to an end at the 2025 World Athletics Championships, as he finished eighth with a best throw of 84.02m.

Watch: Pakistan's Mohammad Haris injures umpire Ruchira with a throw against UAEPakistan wicketkeeper Mohammad Haris accidentally hit umpire Ruchira Palliyaguruge during the Asia Cup 2025 match against the UAE. He was immediately taken off the field and replaced by Gazi Sohel, who officiated as on-field umpire in his place.

Young Sachin Yadav misses World Championships medal by 40 centimetersIndia's Sachin Yadav came within touching distance of a medal at the World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo, finishing fourth with a personal best of 86.27m in his very first attempt. The 25-year-old, competing in his maiden world final, missed out on bronze by just 40 centimetres but announced himself as a rising force in men's javelin.

Neeraj Chopra fails to win medal after 7 years, young Sachin announces arrivalWorld Athletics Championships 2025: Neeraj Chopra's winning streak that lasted 7 years came to an end as his title defence in Tokyo ended in disappointment. However, 25-year-old Sachin Yadav announced his arrival on the big stage with a fourth-place finish on Thursday, September 18.

Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem makes shock exit from javelin finalWorld Athletics Championships 2025: Pakistan's Arshad Nadeem, who won the Olympic gold medal in Paris last year, failed to win a medal in Tokyo after managing a best throw of 82.75 metres.

Rohit Sharma credited by ex-cricketer for Abhishek Sharma's rise: He put this habitFormer India cricketer Ajay Jadeja credited Rohit Sharma's selfless approach for Abhishek Sharma's explosive rise in T20Is. Abhishek has scored 596 runs in 19 matches with a strike-rate of 195.40 and continues to impress fans with his fearless batting.

Roger Federer welcomes Carlos Alcaraz to Laver Cup, bonds over golf with World No.1Roger Federer welcomed World No.1 Carlos Alcaraz to the 2025 Laver Cup with a golf outing in San Francisco, highlighting their bond beyond tennis. Alcaraz will lead Team Europe, while Federer continues his enduring connection to the event he co-founded.

Zheng Qinwen slams Taylor Townsend after Chinese cuisine comments spark backlashAmerican tennis player Taylor Townsend sparked controversy with remarks on Chinese cuisine during the Billie Jean King Cup finals in Shenzhen. The incident highlighted the importance of cultural respect in global sports and led to a public apology from Townsend.

Focus on playing cricket: Kapil Dev's take on Pakistan's Asia Cup handshake rowKapil Dev has urged Pakistan to shift focus back to cricket, downplaying the handshake controversy from their Asia Cup clash with India. The World Cup legend stressed that performances matter more than symbolic gestures or off-field disputes.

CM Punk comments on future after WWE retirement: There's 1000 hats I could wearCM Punk has spoken about his WWE future after retirement, revealing he could take up roles like commentary, producing, or creative work. Ahead of WrestlePalooza 2025, Punk also teased he still has plenty left in the tank.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
